intro: Freycinetia novohibernica, commonly known as the New Zealand freycinetia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its long, narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found growing in coastal areas and lowland forests, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
